intro: Galium pseudokurdicum, commonly known as the Kurdish bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually white or pale pink, with four petals. Galium pseudokurdicum is characterized by its ability to thrive in temperate climates and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
